**Lighthouse Point** is a city in [Broward
County](/wiki/Broward_County,_Florida "Broward County, Florida"),
[Florida](/wiki/Florida "Florida"), United States. The city was named for the
[Hillsboro Inlet Lighthouse](/wiki/Hillsboro_Inlet_Light "Hillsboro Inlet
Light"), which is located in nearby [Hillsboro
Beach](/wiki/Hillsboro_Beach,_Florida "Hillsboro Beach, Florida"). As of the
[2010 census](/wiki/2010_United_States_Census "2010 United States Census"),
the population of Lighthouse Point was 10,344. The city is part of the
[Miami–Fort Lauderdale–Pompano Beach Metropolitan Statistical
Area](/wiki/South_Florida_metropolitan_area "South Florida metropolitan
area"), which was home to 5,564,635 people at the 2010 census.

##
Geography[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Lighthouse_Point,_Florida&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Geography")]

Lighthouse Point is located at [26°16′29″N 80°05′22″W﻿ / ﻿26.274691°N
80.089414°W﻿ / 26.274691;
-80.089414](//tools.wmflabs.org/geohack/geohack.php?pagename=Lighthouse_Point,_Florida&params=26.274691_N_-80.089414_E_type:city_region:US).[9]
According to the [United States Census
Bureau](/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau "United States Census Bureau"), the
city has a total area of 2.4 square miles (6 km2), of which 2.29 square miles
(6 km2) is land and .11 square miles (0 km2) (4.58%) is water.

Lighthouse Point is located in northeastern Broward County. It is adjacent to
the following municipalities:

To its north:

  * [Deerfield Beach](/wiki/Deerfield_Beach,_Florida "Deerfield Beach, Florida")

To its east:

  * [Hillsboro Beach](/wiki/Hillsboro_Beach,_Florida "Hillsboro Beach, Florida") (across the [Intracoastal Waterway](/wiki/Intracoastal_Waterway "Intracoastal Waterway"))

To its west and south:

  * [Pompano Beach](/wiki/Pompano_Beach,_Florida "Pompano Beach, Florida")

As of 2010, there were 5,774 households out of which 15.1% were vacant. In
2000, 19.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 50.7% were
married couples living together, 6.0% had a female householder with no husband
present, and 40.4% were non-families. 33.6% of all households were made up of
individuals and 16.3% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or
older. The average household size was 2.08 and the average family size was
2.65.

In 2000, the city the population was spread out with 16.2% under the age of
18, 3.4% from 18 to 24, 27.1% from 25 to 44, 30.1% from 45 to 64, and 23.2%
who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 47 years. For every 100
females there were 91.8 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there
were 89.4 males.

As of 2000, the median income for a household in the city was $53,038, and the
median income for a family was $72,418. Males had a median income of $51,897
versus $32,929 for females. The [per capita income](/wiki/Per_capita_income
"Per capita income") for the city was $40,839. About 2.6% of families and 5.0%
of the population were below the [poverty line](/wiki/Poverty_line "Poverty
line"), including 3.8% of those under age 18 and 6.5% of those age 65 or over.

As of 2000, speakers of [English](/wiki/English_language "English language")
as their [first language](/wiki/First_language "First language") were 89.18%,
while 4.64% spoke [Spanish](/wiki/Spanish_language "Spanish language") as
theirs. Other languages spoken as a first language are
[Italian](/wiki/Italian_language "Italian language") 1.93%,
[French](/wiki/French_language "French language") 1.22%,
[German](/wiki/German_language "German language") at 1.06%, while
[Portuguese](/wiki/Portuguese_language "Portuguese language") being the
[mother tongue](/wiki/Mother_tongue "Mother tongue") of 0.71% of all
residents.[11]

##
Media[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Lighthouse_Point,_Florida&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Media")]

Lighthouse Point is part of the [Miami](/wiki/Miami "Miami")-[Fort
Lauderdale](/wiki/Fort_Lauderdale,_Florida "Fort Lauderdale,
Florida")-[Hollywood](/wiki/Hollywood,_Florida "Hollywood, Florida") media
market, which is the twelfth largest radio market[12] and the seventeenth
largest television market[13] in the United States. Its primary daily
newspapers are the _[South Florida Sun-Sentinel](/wiki/South_Florida_Sun-
Sentinel "South Florida Sun-Sentinel")_ and _[The Miami
Herald](/wiki/The_Miami_Herald "The Miami Herald")_ , and their
[Spanish](/wiki/Spanish_language "Spanish language")-language counterparts
_[El Sentinel](/wiki/El_Sentinel_del_Sur_de_la_Florida "El Sentinel del Sur de
la Florida")_ and _[El Nuevo Herald](/wiki/El_Nuevo_Herald "El Nuevo
Herald")_. Each house, apartment and business in Lighthouse Point receives the
monthly, glossy, lifestyle magazine "Lighthouse Point" created and mailed by
publishers Susan and Richard Rosser.

##
Education[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Lighthouse_Point,_Florida&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Education")]

[Broward County Public Schools](/wiki/Broward_County_Public_Schools "Broward
County Public Schools") serves the community.

**Elementary Schools**

  * Cresthaven Elementary School (located in [Pompano Beach](/wiki/Pompano_Beach,_Florida "Pompano Beach, Florida"), [Florida](/wiki/Florida "Florida"))
  * Norcrest Elementary School (located in Pompano Beach, Florida)

**Middle Schools**

  * Crystal Lake Middle School (located in Pompano Beach, Florida)
  * Deerfield Beach Middle School (located in [Deerfield Beach](/wiki/Deerfield_Beach,_Florida "Deerfield Beach, Florida"), [Florida](/wiki/Florida "Florida"))
  * Pompano Beach Middle School (located in Pompano Beach, Florida)

**High Schools**

  * [Deerfield Beach High School](/wiki/Deerfield_Beach_High_School "Deerfield Beach High School") (located in Deerfield Beach, Florida)

Originally [North Broward Preparatory
School](/wiki/North_Broward_Preparatory_School "North Broward Preparatory
School") was located in the city. It was established there in 1957, but is no
longer located in Lighthouse Point.[14]
